Sketch Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 1. Draw a line from the point (0.0, 0.0) to (0.0093, 0.0). 2. Draw a line from the point (0.0093, 0.0) to (0.0093, 0.0013). 3. Draw a line from the point (0.0093, 0.0013) to (0.0053, 0.0013). 4. Draw a line from the point (0.0053, 0.0013) to (0.0053, 0.0106). 5. Draw a line from the point (0.0053, 0.0106) to (0.004, 0.0106). 6. Draw a line from the point (0.004, 0.0106) to (0.004, 0.0013). 7. Draw a line from the point (0.004, 0.0013) to (0.0, 0.0013). 8. Draw a line from the point (0.0, 0.0013) to (0.0, 0.0). Extrusion Extrude the sketch in the z-direction (normal direction) with an extrusion depth of 0.75. Apply the sketch scale parameter as 0.0106 to the sketch. Description The height of the part is 0.75, with a length of 0.0106 and a width of 0.0106. The resulting shape is a long, thin, cylindrical object with a flat base and a slightly tapered top. It has a series of evenly spaced holes along its length. Part 2: Adding holes along the length Continuing from Part 1, add holes uniformly spaced along its length. Sketch (on face_1) Create a new sketch on face_1. 1. Draw a circle, centered at the point (0.0045, 0.006, 0.0), with a radius of 0.0004. 2. Draw four additional circles with the same radius, centered at the points (0.0045, 0.006 + i\\*0.0026, 0.0); where i ranges from 1 to 4. Note: These circles are the cross-sections of the holes. The distance (0.0026) between circles is decided by dividing the height by the number of holes. Extrusion Extrude the circles in the z-direction (normal direction) to the depth of the part created in Part 1, i.e., 0.75. Use the "CutFeatureOperation" to ensure the holes are subtracted from the body. Description The height of the part remains 0.75, while the length is now 0.0106 and a width of 0.0106, with five holes uniformly spaced along the length of the cylindrical object.</description>
